title: Through international collaboration, scientists find cause of InSight’s most powerful Marsquake
summary: An international team of scientists has found the cause of the largest Martian seismic event, or Marsquake, observed by NASA’s Interior Exploration using Seismic Investigations, Geodesy and Heat Transport (InSight) Mars lander. After ruling out a meteor impact, they concluded the event must have been caused by a release of stress within the planet’s crust.

title: Space Force sets sights on small geostationary communications satellites
summary: The U.S. Space Force is exploring the use of small geosynchronous satellites to enhance military communications networks — either through purchased commercial services or government-owned constellations.

title: NASA starts reassessment of Mars Sample Return architecture
summary: NASA has started work to revise its approach to returning samples from Mars after an independent review concluded the current Mars Sample Return (MSR) architecture has an “unrealistic” budget and schedule.

title: India Aces Crew Capsule Abort Test
summary: India successfully completed a high altitude crew capsule abort test for its nascent Gaganyaan human spaceflight program today. The first attempt scrubbed just before liftoff, but they quickly found and […]

title: India tests launch escape system in step towards sending astronauts to orbit
summary: India took a step towards independent human spaceflight capabilities early Saturday with a successful uncrewed emergency escape system test.
